location_paper: "University of Puerto Rico's Toa Baja experimental station located on the northern (Atlantic) coast of Puerto Rico"
veg_typepaper: study site was dominated by grasses, principally Panicum maximum and Tricholaena repens, with ca. 30 species of herbs and vines, principally Asteraceae, Papilionaceae and Euphorbiaceae; woody plants were absent
inv_degree: planted: initial tree spacing in all forest plots was 1 m x 1 m,plots 16mx16m
controltype_study: unplanted control,plots were dominated (>95%) by grasses (Panicum maximum and Tricholaena repens), with scattered vine and forb species

location_paper: Suzaki on Chichijima Island, which is one of the Ogasawara Islands
